Sentencas: The metal-ceramic composite Cu/Ce0.9Mn0.1O2-delta (Cu/CMO) is investigated as a fuel electrode for solid oxide cells (SOCs) regarding the interconversion between CO and CO2, and exhibits excellent anti-carbon and electrocatalytic performance.
Titulo: Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells

Sentencas: When the SOCs are operated in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) mode in CO2/CO = 50/50 atmosphere, the maximum power densities of the SOCs are 37, 88, and 151 mW/cm(2) at 700, 750, and 800 degrees C, respectively, indicating that Cu/CMO electrode possesses excellent catalytic activity for CO oxidation.
Titulo: Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The Cu/CMO is also electrochemically active for CO2 reduction when the SOCs are operated in solid oxide electrolytic cell (SOEC) mode.
Titulo: Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells

Sentencas: At an applied voltage of 2.0 V, the current densities of the SOCs are 0.47, 0.87, and 1.36 A/cm(2) at 700, 750, and 800 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Short-term durability measurement of CO2 electrolysis at various applied voltages shows that the SOCs is stable with only a small decrease in current density at 1.4 V, while the current density decreases more above 2.0 V, probably due to the deterioration of the electrode at high applied voltages.
Titulo: Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Long-term stability measurement of the SOCs at an applied voltage of 1.4 V for up to 200 h shows significant stability of the electrode.
Titulo: Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells
Electrochemical behaviors of copper/manganese-doped ceria cermet as a fuel electrode for high-temperature solid oxide cells
